text: Good morning, I’m a new developer interning for a company who uses HubSpot. I built a tool to model how well their product works with a React front-end. We are looking at options for deployment — I’m wondering if creating a HubSpot module is feasible for this project. The project receives a user’s input, fires calculations (to a python back-end/flask api route) and returns the results of the calculations in the browser. I started looking at the react boilerplate on the website…wanted to float the idea to the community to see if it even seems possible? From the information I’ve read by HubSpot, I can’t tell if the platform supports full scale react apps.

The cleanest way, for sure, is to use the boilerplate to create a section containing your app. The section can, in theory, be the only thing on the page, but ideally you would keep your global site header and footer navigation.

That’s one reason I’m compelled to use it! Where’s a good place to start if I haven’t developed anything on HubSpot before? I’m a bit intimidated by the hubl syntax and other platform specific techniques
I  can’t npm install cms-react-boilerplate. I’m on a macbook with the m1 chip

Hello everyone! I have three questions about third party scripts that are loading on our frontend web application as a result of integrating with HubSpot.
My questions are as follows:
1. Why are these scripts injected? The scripts I see appear to be related to Google Leads and LinkedIn. 
2. What are they doing for us — are these scripts servicing a feature that we have turned on in HubSpot? 
3. How do we remove these scripts and what are the consequences of doing so?
I’ll look forward to hearing from you and I appreciate the help!
Never mind, I just found the reason <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/ads/connect-your-google-ads-account-to-HubSpot>.
